required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Preventive Potential of Bilirubin

brief_summary.textblock:
The prevalence of mild hyperbilirubinemia, also known as Gilbert´s Syndrome, is usually defined using an unconjugated bilirubin (UCB) blood concentration above 17.1 µmol/l. The prevalence of GS is remarkably common, affecting 5-10% (depending on ethnicity and gender) of the adult population.
The aim of this project is to investigate whether there is a difference in health related marker between 60 subjects with Gilbert´s Syndrome (mild hyperbilirubinaemia) and 60 age and gender matched control subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider Lipid parameter
primary_outcome.description: Compare plasma parameter of lipid metabolism (Cholesterol, LDL, HDL, Triglycerides, ..) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider plasma parameter of glucose metabolism
secondary_outcome.description: Compare plasma parameter of glucose metabolism (plasma glucose (mg/dl), plasma insulin (µU/ml), C-peptide (ng/ml)) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider AMPK metabolic pathway
secondary_outcome.description: Compare parameter of the AMPK metabolic pathway (phosphorylated AMPK (rfU), phosphorylated Ppar-alpha (rfU), phosphorylated Ppar-gamma (rfU)) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider body composition
secondary_outcome.description: Compare parameter of the body composition (BMI (kg/m2), fat mass (%), waist circumference (cm), hip circumference (cm), abdominal circumference (cm)) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider heme catabolic pathway
secondary_outcome.description: Compare parameter of the heme catabolic pathway (expression of heme oxygenase (RQ), expression of Biliverdinreductase (RQ)) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider the metabolomic response
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the metabolomic pattern (ie all metabolites; analyzed using both nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and mass spectrometry (MS) techniques) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider the composition of gut-microbiota
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the composition of the gut microbiota (Gene sequencing of the 16S rRNA on the stool samples are performed to identify the microbes down to genus level as well as the microbial diversity and relative abundance) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider oxidative stress marker
secondary_outcome.description: Compare plasma concentrations of oxidative stress marker such as malondialdehyde or GSH/GSSG between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider anabolic and catabolic hormones
secondary_outcome.description: Compare plasma concentrations of hormones (Glucagon (pg/ml), T3 (pg/ml), TSH(µM/ml),) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider telomere length
secondary_outcome.description: Compare telomere length between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider RNA and DNA gene expression
secondary_outcome.description: Compare RNA and DNA gene expression between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigators will consider the metabolomic response after a standard breakfast
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the metabolomic pattern after a standard breakfast (ie all metabolites; analyzed using both nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and mass spectrometry (MS) techniques) between Gilbert´s Syndrome subjects and controls.

arm_group.description: Subjects with mild hyperbilirubinaemia and a plasma level of unconjugated bilirubin of 17.1 µmol.
Healthy controls with lower plasma level of unconjugated bilirubin of 17.1 µmol, aen and gender matched.

study_pop.textblock: 120 participants, 60 participants with mild hyperbilirubinaemia, 60 subjects without mild hyperbilirubinaemia, age and gender matching.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
In general
- Signed declaration of consent
- Age: 20-80 years
- Liver enzymes (AST, ALT, GGT) < 1.5x over norm values
- Non smoking
- Moderate physical activity
- Ability to communicate with the study team in the local language to understand the study procedure
Cases (GS):
- Total blood bilirubin > 1.2 mg/dl
- Unconjugated bilirubin > 1 mg/dl
Controls (non-GS):
- Total blood bilirubin ≤ 1.2 mg/dl
- Unconjugated bilirubin ≤ 1 mg/dl
Exclusion Criteria:
In general
- Age < 20 or > 80 years
- Cardiovascular diseases
- Liver diseases (including Hep B and C)
- Cholelithiasis
- Hemolysis
- Renal diseases
- Active tumors
- Diabetes mellitus
- Smoking
- Professional athletes
- Subjects with organ transplants
- Intake of antioxidants within the last 4 weeks
- Intake of liver influencing medication within the last 5 weeks
Cases (GS):
- Total blood bilirubin ≤ 1.2 mg/dl
- Unconjugated bilirubin ≤ 1 mg/dl
Controls (non-GS):
- Total blood bilirubin > 1.2 mg/dl
- Unconjugated bilirubin > 1 mg/dl
